summary: Email correspondence between the U.S. Attorney's Office and the chambers of Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding victim attendance at an upcoming arraignment conference in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The government reports that three victims will not attend, while Victim-2 plans to attend by phone, with her attorneys David Boies and Sigrid McCawley attending in person.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Presiding judge in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell; her chambers are coordinating the arraignment conference attendance details.

persons.name: Juan Ruiz Toro
persons.context: Law Clerk to Judge Alison J. Nathan; corresponds with attorneys to confirm attendance details for the arraignment conference.

persons.name: David Boies
persons.context: Attorney representing Victim-2; plans to attend the arraignment conference in person.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Attorney representing Victim-2; plans to attend the arraignment conference in person.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell; subject of the upcoming arraignment conference.

connections.description: Co-counsel representing Victim-2 in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

Law Clerk to Judge Alison J. Nathan, acting on behalf of the judge's chambers.

events.title: Court Scheduling Order
events.description: Judge Nathan issued a scheduling order directing the government to inform the court about victim attendance at the upcoming arraignment.

events.title: Government Response on Victim Attendance
events.description: The government reported to the court that Victim-1, Victim-3, and Victim-4 would not attend the arraignment conference, while Victim-2 plans to attend by phone with her attorneys present in person.

keyFacts: The government confirmed that three victims (Victim-1, Victim-3, Victim-4) referenced in the Superseding Indictment would not attend the upcoming arraignment conference in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
Victim-2 planned to attend the arraignment conference by phone, with her attorneys David Boies and Sigrid McCawley attending in person.
The communication was in response to a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan dated April 19, 2021, regarding victim attendance.
The document reveals ongoing legal proceedings and victim participation logistics in United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330) as of April 2021.
